lessons.title: 1. Hello, World!
lessons.description: The classic first step. Print exactly Hello, World!
lessons.tutorial:
In Python, use print() to write text to the console.

# This line will print "Welcome to Python!"
print("Welcome to Python!")

# This will print a number. Numbers don't need quotes.
print(123)

For this lesson, print the exact phrase "Hello, World!".

lessons.title: 2. Variables & Data Types
lessons.description: Create a variable named my_number with value 42 and print it.
lessons.initialCode:
# Declare a variable named my_number with value 42
# Then print it
lessons.tutorial:
In Python, you create a variable by assigning a value using =.

  • int: whole numbers (e.g., 5, -10, 42)
  • str: text like "Hello"
  • float: decimal numbers (e.g., 3.14)
  • bool: True or False
age = 25
score = 100
print(score)  # Prints 100

lessons.title: 3. While Loops
lessons.description: Use a while loop to print numbers 1 through 5, each on a new line.
lessons.initialCode:
i = 1
# Create a while loop that runs while i <= 5.
# Inside the loop, print i and then increment it.
lessons.tutorial:
A while loop repeats a block as long as a condition is true.

countdown = 3
while countdown > 0:
    print(countdown)
    countdown -= 1
print("Blast off!")

lessons.title: 4. For Loops
lessons.description: Use a for loop to print numbers 0 to 4, each on a new line.
lessons.initialCode: # Create a for loop that iterates 5 times and prints the index
lessons.tutorial:
Use range(n) to loop from 0 to n-1.

for i in range(3):
    print("Iteration", i)
